title: Logan TSA agents to earn $10,000 bonuses after shutdown, Noem says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News More than 270 TSA agents at Logan did not miss a day of work during the 43-day shutdown, Noam said.
She did not specify how many will receive the bonus.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem visits Logan Airport in Boston Saturday.

title: Bruins are already reaping rewards of their trade-deadline teardown

title: Jaylen Brown, Celtics hold off James Harden, Clippers late to claim rare clutch win: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm and Audrey Cooney
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics held off a spirited push from James Harden and the Clippers in the fourth quarter for a hard-fought 121-118 victory.
Celtics guard Jaylen Brown (7) moves past Los Angeles Clippers center Brook Lopez (11) during third quarter action at TD Garden on November 16, 2025.

title: ‘Reckless and distressing’: Allston Car Wash responds to BU student taking credit for ICE raid
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “Publicly labeling our workforce as ‘criminals’ without any knowledge of who they are is reckless and distressing,” the car wash said.
Allston Car Wash, where nine people were recently detained by ICE agents in an immigration raid.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe By Molly Farrar November 16, 2025 | 6:10 PM 2 minutes to read A car wash in Allston responded to a Boston University student publicly taking credit for reporting their employees to federal immigration officials, calling his actions “reckless and distressing.

title: Megan Keller named captain of Boston Fleet
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: PWHL "t’s an important task at hand and I couldn’t be more excited for the opportunity ahead.
” Megan Keller has not missed a game for the Boston Fleet.
Brett Phelps for The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan November 16, 2025 | 4:30 PM 2 minutes to read The Boston Fleet officially have their new captain.

title: Medford man arrested twice in one day, allegedly hit tow lot workers with impounded car
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man was first arrested for driving with a suspended license, then arrested again after a botched attempt to get his car back.

By Darin Zullo November 16, 2025 | 11:19 AM 1 minute to read A Medford teen is facing assault charges for allegedly hitting two Charlestown tow lot employees with his impounded car, according to Massachusetts State Police.

title: Boston animal shelter receives $2M donation for facility construction
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The Animal Rescue League of Boston’s new facility has been under construction since the spring and is expected to be completed in 2026.
The Animal Rescue League of Boston received a $2 million donation to fund construction of its new three-story facility in the South End.

Animal Rescue League of Boston By Darin Zullo November 16, 2025 | 10:23 AM 1 minute to read A Boston animal shelter organization has received the largest single gift in its history for a new facility, according to the Boston Business Journal.

title: Person shot on Beacon Hill, hospitalized with life-threatening injuries
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The shooting victim has not yet been identified but was taken to a hospital with life-threatening injuries Friday, police said.
By Darin Zullo November 16, 2025 | 9:24 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A person has been hospitalized with life-threatening injuries after they were shot Friday morning on Beacon Hill, according to Boston police.
